greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(n) = A227413(A005941(n)).
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: For all n >= 1,  A010051(a(n)) = 1 - A000035(n). [This permutation maps even numbers to primes and odd numbers to nonprimes, in some order, because the permutation A227413 has the same property and A005941 preserves the parity].
program: A002808(n) = { my(k=-1); while( -n + n += -k + k=primepi(n), ); n }; \\ This function from _M. F. Hasler_
A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
xref: Similar or related permutations: A005941, A156552, A227413, A246364, A246366.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 26 2014
